i am definitely not going to use this app. i placed an order and which i did cancel it within few seconds and my card was charged with the amount. the app said that it will take few business days to refund the amount. its been few days and my bank statement came and i was charged, though i cancelled my delivery within few seconds of ordering.

i am literally appalled at the quality of service i've received. 

i made 3 orders over a week period. i was charged for each of those orders, and the payments were processed.

a week later, i am charged again for those three orders, all at once. they double charged me for three orders! this was over $60.

this overdrew my account, and i was subsequently charged four "returned item" fees, $35.00 each, a total of $140.00. including the overcharges, $204.33. over $200. 

so naturally i contact postmates as soon as i notice, assuming i will be refunded and it's all just a big mistake. they don't have a phone line, by the way. 

i sent a very long email full of screenshots of my bank statements and postmates orders, detailing everything that happened. 

i get a literal paragraph long response essentially saying, "those double charges were pre-authorization fees." 

no explanation, no apology, no trying to work with me. 

first of all, how is it a pre-auth if it comes after my account has already been charged? how is a pre-auth charging me over $50 for one order? 

i replied, and got no response. 

my bank (boa) took care of it, refunding everything, and i'm so grateful for their service. 

no help from postmates. 

it's not the mistake that pisses me off. accidents happen (although, seeing all these reviews makes it seem like it's a pretty common occurrence). 

it's the service i received. if i'm spending $25 on $13 worth of food with your company, the least you can do is pretend to care about your customers.

please beware. what they are doing is borderline criminal and fraudulent.

i been charged twice and there was no notification until i check my bank statement.

please use grubhub, to avoid getting robbed

i signed up for postmates unlimited, i used it frequently during the pandemic in 2020. my husband noticed he was getting random charges on our bank statement. turns out they were charging me delivery fees even though i had unlimited but it was not showing my total.  when you add up the items and taxes, the total was always $5 dollars more.  i immediately canceled their unlimited service and deleted the app in oct.  surprise, they started charging me again april 2021.  this company is a major fraud.  make sure you add up your total.

i started using postmates about two years ago so i'm pretty forgiving and patient but i have finally deleted the app because this company is horrible.  i have had way more negative experiences than i have good.  the app over charges you no matter what and you don't notice till two days later when you match the charges and then by then according to their policy it's too late.  everytime i had something wrong with my order noone would contact me and my money would never be refunded like i was told.  there are other apps that i will be exploring but my time with postmates is done and all i can say is here is your warning and make sure you compare your bank statement with the app receipt.  oh and always ask for the physical receipts from the drivers.

i used doordash for the first time friday night. after an hour of waiting i get a call from my delivery driver letting me know about an altercation that happened between her and the management of the restaurant i ordered from. i ask her to please just cancel my order and make sure my full amount is refunded. she apparently cannot do this so i go through the doordash support to fix this, which was relatively quick and easy. although, it takes 5-7 business days to obtain a refund. i go back to check my account to find out they have now charged me twice for a meal i never even received. i have sent support a screen shot of my bank statement to prove it and they are trying to only give me one refund. so for a meal i never got i have a $120 in charges on my account and i have to wait 5-7 days to get even half of that back. i have yet to find a number to call or anyway to reach someone at doordash except through email. i was excited to use doordash since they have a lot of delivery options but after this experience iÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â£ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â£ÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â¢ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â£ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â¢ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â£ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â¢ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â™m not sure iÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â£ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â£ÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â¢ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â£ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â¢ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â£ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂƒÃ‚Â¢ÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â™d recommend it to anyone.

i used to love this app and would use it regularly to get food from my favorite restaurants delivered to my house. unfortunately i will never use it again as this company has repeatedly demonstrated an utter lack of customer service, and a penchant for committing unethical business practices. beware: if your order is incorrect or missing items, postmates will not fix the issue, and they will keep all of the money you paid, even if you back up your claim with bank statements, receipts, and food tickets pertaining to the order and proving your case. in reply to an email i sent requesting a credit for a missing item, they blatantly lied and stated i had been credited, when all of the records that i meticulously keep indicated otherwise, that i was charged 100% of the original amount. i showed them the initial bank charge, the same bank charge once it posted, and a ticket showing the date and missing item, and still they refused to help. in their email they told me to stop bothering them about the same issue and to stop using their service if i didn't like it. phenomenally unprofessional!!! this has happened on multiple occasions where an order is incorrect and it takes up to two weeks of emailing back and forth before i receive any form of compensation or apology, all the while the "customer service" representatives will send you disgustingly patronizing, condescending emails telling you why you're wrong and they're right (even though in the end, with multiple emails and lots of evidence demonstrating their mistake, they finally admit fault). this time, they refused to acknowledge fault and in so many words, told me to get lost. they would rather pocket your money illegally than retain a loyal paying customer. i will be switching to a competitor for food deliveries (probably uber eats - they're actually an organized company and they've never done me wrong) and will continue to inform everyone i know of this shady company who thrives only because of stealing money from their customers.

i used to love this app but im guessing there isnt an email to write to about incorrect charges and malfunctions for a reason and there office is closed early so i cant even call!! but i got charged $20 for an order the app never placed!! its still telling me to pay for my food when my bank statement say i just did!! i dont have more money on my card to pay for it again

i used to really like this app but unfortunately, they charged me twice on an order ("a hold") and when i tried to get issue resolved, there was no resolution. my bank statement still reflects the charge even tho they deny the charge.

i was a regular postmates user until suddenly my account was suspended for "suspicious activity" by their "irregularity detection system". (apparently, one should not attempt to order a yoga mat from lululemon on a friday night.) i emailed and asked how to resolve the issue. their response baffled me: send a screen shot of a bank statement to verify my address. seriously. 
for over a month, i've emailed, often with no response, but other times with the exact same response. they can't provide a way to un-suspend my account. and they can't provide proof of any suspicious activity. horrible. 
i would not recommend anyone use the service.

i am thankful to my therapist for being responsive, and checking in at least once a day. he was also respectful and professional. i did get 1-2 nuggets of useful advice. however, i found the therapy lacking in many ways and ultimately unhelpful. i was hoping for insight into my situations, but most responses i got were very basicÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â”either easily googled or common sense. still i was hopeful and wanted to give it a chance. i reiterated my goals with my therapist so he knew i wasnÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™t just here to vent, that i was looking for deeper understanding of what was going on. i continued to find the responses more of repetitions of what i said rather than anything i could learn from. i even tried nudging him in the right direction by suggesting possible explanations i learned from my own reading, hoping he would delve deeper. in response my therapist would agree with me and give a one sentence ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Âœelaboration.ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â i felt he was just trying to keep me happy and ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Âœfeeling heard,ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â but i couldnÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™t get much depth or new information from him. he honestly seemed to be trying his best but either through lack of skill/knowledge or the formatÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™s limitations, this therapy did not deliver. after a few weeks i found that answering the messages felt like a chore. i responded to the therapist just to get it off my to do list. i wasnÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™t getting anything useful from it.

 

btw, i was a little put off that i had to include an emergency contactÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™s full name and phone number. i had hoped for some anonymity due to the personal nature of things i would talk about. i tried to give just a first name, but he would not continue without a first and last name, and phone number. 

overall, from my experience i donÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™t think this format of therapy is going to help people looking for real therapy. the delay in response time (which to be fair, they warn you about) and that itÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™s written, makes it hard to connect or get deeper. not sure who this would work for? it really makes me wonder about the validity of some of these reviews.... if you want to pay $300+ a month for someone to read your texts and agree with you then sure. but i regret opening up about highly personal things and spending the money i did. i feel i can get better information googling mental health advice than from this.

i started my account by entering email, creating password, and stating nickname. i got a nice cordial greeting from angela, the intake person who supposedly would chat with me and match me with an appropriate therapist. however, after that initial greeting, when i responded and answered the first questions, my name and age, and my location, i got nothing back. not a person, not even a standard message, nothing. after a couple futile attempts to ask about what was happening, i typed in to forget it. maybe itÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™s just a scam? not sure what to think but iÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™m not wasting anymore time on it. too bad. seems like a good idea.

deciding to try to get some help myself was a difficult decision. i badly wanted this to work out for me, but a lack of support from talkspace eventually left me in a worse place than when i started. 

talkspace fails on every promise made in the description. while it may be convenient to type out what youÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™re feeling in the app, this is effectively like yelling into a black hole. at no point did i feel confident that all my messages were read. there was no continuity on the responses that could ever constitute an actual conversation. the five or so total messages i received in the course of a week were just generalized patronization, with no thought or concern for anything i was actually trying to convey.

the service is in no way discrete of anonymous. youÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™ll be forced to provide details information on yourself, your location, and ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚ÂœcontactsÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â or family members. this was a big deal for me and i feel like this was entirely misrepresented. 

and while the claim of affordable could be debated, it feels a lot more like outright robbery when you consider you may not actually being offered anything for your payment except someone pretending they read your messages before sending an underwhelming response every day or two.

the worst part of this service is no one is there to help you navigate the process. i asked for some direction from all the different people i spoke to when getting matched up with a therapist and from the therapist themselves, but no one actually provided any. i was told ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚ÂœthereÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™s no wrong way to do thisÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â and other nonsensical information that eventually left me getting match up with someone that evidently didnÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™t even want to help. from there no direction left me lost as to what to do. i tried just typing out things that i though might be helpful, but then i just felt ignored. i asked for specific things i could type in and was told ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Âœjust put as much or as little about anything you want.ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â there was never any progress. i basically felt worse all the time, knowing i chose the service and kept paying for it, but was never receiving any help.

i gave a great effort to try to make this service work for me, i continued using (and paying) for multiple months, but putting in all my effort is sometimes mentally and physically exhausting, and i felt like no one ever cared if i tried or not. by the end the therapist just stopped talking to me. my last live session was never schedule. i submitted feedback multiple times indicating i felt there was no progress (they have you fill out multiple surveys as you go), but those, too, seemed to have lost to the void of talkspace. if i didnÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™t feel worthless before i stated i surely did by the time i decided i needed to cancel. and even after completing the cancelation form explaining why i wanted to cancel, weeks before my paid time was over, still no contact from anyone. i guess when they find out you wonÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™t be paying for future months no one has any interest in continuing to provide you the service youÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™ve already paid for.

if youÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™re really looking for some help, do your self a favor and just skip this app. iÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™m sure that thereÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™s some people that might find it helpful to just type out into the void, and get an ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Âœi hear youÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â or ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚ÂœthatÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™s too badÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â response once a day, five days a week, from someone that may or may not have read anything you typed, but if youÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™re looking for anything else i donÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™t think youÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â™ll find it in this app.

ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â”ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â”ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â”ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â”ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â”ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â”ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â”ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â”ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â”ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â”ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â”ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â”ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â”ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â”ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â”ÃƒÂ£Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â€ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚Â”
